title: One pot pasta with chorizo

ingredients.content: 50 g Parmesan cheese, crusts removed and cut into pieces (3 cm)
1 brown onion (approx. 120 g), cut into halves
2 sprigs fresh flat-leaf parsley, leaves only
1 - 1 ½ tbsp Vegetable stock paste (see Tips)
2 sprigs fresh basil, leaves only, for garnishing
12 pitted Kalamata olives, cut into slices (optional)

preparations.content: Place a thermal serving bowl or other large bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh spinach into it. Set aside.
Place Parmesan cheese into mixing bowl and grate <b>10 sec/speed 9<b>. Transfer into a separate bowl and set aside.
Place onion, garlic, carrot, parsley and tomatoes into mixing bowl and blend <b>10 sec/speed 7<b>.
Add water, stock paste, pepper and chorizo into mixing bowl and cook <b>5 min/100°C//speed <b>, placing simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid.

Add spaghetti through hole in mixing bowl lid and cook <b>15 min/90°C//speed <b>, until al dente, using spatula to submerge pasta into sauce, then place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid once pasta is completely covered in sauce.
Transfer pasta and sauce into bowl with reserved spinach and stir well to combine.
Divide between serving bowls. Top with basil leaves and olives (optional), then serve warm with reserved Parmesan cheese.

hintsAndTricks: Please refer to The Basic Cookbook or Everyday Cookbook for the Vegetable stock paste recipe.
